name: stutterer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who speaks or says something, especially the first part of a word, with difficulty, for example pausing or repeating a sound several times: The course offers stutterers various techniques and tools that can help them. See
stutter
More examplesFewer examplesFor us stutterers, there's comfort in associating our difficulty with similarly afflicted celebrities.One of the biggest misconceptions is that stutterers are anxious or psychologically different.He's a stutterer who's never experienced the simple delight of pizza because he can't seem to get the word out when he's standing in line at the cafeteria.Talking can be an exercise in frustration for stutterers. It used to be believed that a stutterer's tongue was either too long or too short, too wet or too dry.
